title: In den Archiven gefunden
description: Bislang nicht zu Wort gekommene Zeitzeugen, neue Perspektiven, Zahlen und Fakten. Schicksale, Begebenheiten und die immer wiederkehrende Frage – haben wir Menschen aus der Geschichte etwas gelernt? All dies und mehr jeden Dienstag ab 10 Uhr. Der Podcast ist Teil des „Archives, Research and Digitization“ Programm des Pilecki-Instituts Berlin. In Zusammenarbeit mit u.a. dem Bundesarchiv werden unbekannte oder nur schwer verfügbare Dokumente und Quellen erschlossen und digitalisiert. Ziel ist, diese der akademischen Welt zur Verfügung zu stellen, aber auch die aus dem Archivgut gewonnenen Erkenntnisse in die Öffentlichkeit zu tragen. Letzterem Anspruch wollen wir nun u.a. durch unsere neue Podcast-Reihe „In den Archiven gefunden“ gerecht werden.

title: The Civic Podcast
description:
Hello everyone,

This podcast is a space to discuss, debate and dialogue about important matters that our society is facing. The goal is to keep it civil, keep it respectful and keep it tolerant. Common understanding and the exchange of ideas is the only way forward where critical thinking can prevail in this chaotic world we live in. 

Various topics will be covered, from society to the economy, from culture to religion, from art to technology. Every single aspect, factor and fact has an effect on the way we think and the way we act. A multidisciplinary approach needs to be taken when speaking about important topics that have an impact on policy, culture and our current socio-economic structures. 

I hope that throughout the podcast people will learn and listen to other points of view, but more importantly that the listeners think by themselves and come up with their own conclusions about was is just and fair. I really do believe that good information and intentions can bring out the best in people, let's make that a reality and revolutionise the way we think, act, discuss and interact with each other.

title: The Women of Regenerative Ag: Transforming the Health of the Soil, Land & People
description:
This is a platform for the extraordinary women leading the regenerative agricultural movement—and the transformation of our societies--around the world. They are on the ground, creating critical shifts in seemingly intractable and highly unsustainable systems. And they've been doing so for a long time. 

In this series, we look to explore beyond the soil, to the underlying theme of transformation itself across multiple dimensions: from that very internal landscape of human consciousness to the outer manifestation in the world around us, be it in the form of agricultural management practices, tools and techniques, to culture, economics, policy, and the built environment. 
 
This series is a joint venture with Soil4Climate and my own organization, the Ouroboros Agency, where we work to help transform the human social infrastructure, and the built environment, to create truly resilient and regenerative societies. 
 
These recordings originally aired as interactive livestream interviews on social media. They were held during the initial months of the US Covid lockdown and due to limited facilities, we sometimes had to get creative with our locations and dealt with the occasional technical issue.

Available in all major podcast platforms, including Spotify, Google Podcasts, and Apple Podcasts, among others. TechnoViews is produced by the Sci-Tech Asia International Research Network and is supported by the Research Cluster “Technoscience, Society, and Environment” of the Research Center for Anthropology and Health at the University of Coimbra.

Podcast Team: Joseph BOSCO, Gonçalo D. SANTOS, Nicolas STERNSDORFF-CISTERNA, and Jun ZHANG

title: Down To Earth
description: Climate change tends to trigger strong emotions. There is a lot of noise surrounding the concept. It’s complex, abstract but the impact is very real and every single person on planet Earth is concerned. The story tends to be pretty gloomy but four keen Imperial College beans pursuing a master in Climate Change, Management and Finance decided to shift the narrative. Down to Earth is a podcast which aims at reuniting people on our power to act together. Through different episodes, Danielle, Marie, Chris and Anne-Laure go beyond the infuriating climate news and critically look at how sustainability is approached in different local contexts. Curiosity and climate justice are at the very heart of this podcast. We believe a better understanding of different and unknown realities allows for a stronger collective action on climate change.

title: The Hidden Addiction Podcast
description: Hello and welcome to the Hidden Addiction Podcast. This podcast is brought to you by the New York Council on Problem Gambling. Across New York state we have 7 resource centers dedicated to connecting individuals to care. We are here to increase awareness about problem gambling and advocate for support services for persons adversely affected by problem gambling. Problem Gambling is defined as risking something of value on a game of chance. There can be many types of gambling, and it can affect anyone at any time in their life. It may not be talked about often and kept in the dark, but we hope this podcast sheds light on the hidden addiction of gambling and brings forth resources and information for you to use.
author_name: New York Council on Problem Gambling

title: The Measuring what Matters Podcast
description:
Anyone who has attempted to bake a cake will tell you the importance of accurate measurement. A small error in measurement can spell disaster for hours of work. Imagine for a moment, what it would be like if the way we measured ingredients was not standardized? Even worse, what if we couldn’t even agree on what we were actually trying to make in the first place? This has been the state of wellbeing metrics over the last century, and although excellent projects have been implemented, all too often they are dismissed before their impact can be felt.

Currently, wellbeing & prosperity metrics are benefiting from a wave of innovation stemming from all around the globe. These pushes against traditional boundaries are leading the way to more inclusive and resilient frameworks. This podcast will explore the bleeding edge of social metrics, lessons learned from past attempts, and potential futures, through interviews with experts in community prosperity measurement and decision-making. The podcast will also dig deeper into the question “How is Calgary really performing as a city?”

title: Le Shack politique
description:

Chaque semaine, il tentera d'éclaircir un enjeu de politique et ce, en établissant des faits scientifiques tout en étant drôle! C'est ta chance pour écouter un podcast rempli de blagues, de comparaisons scientifiques déroutantes, de beaux lapsus et de paranthèses de soccer, sport qui passionne Alexis! 
La 1ère série d'épisodes porteront sur la compétition entre les milliardaires Elon Musk, Jeff Bezos et Richard Branson pour conquérir l'espace! Enfile ton casque d'écoute pour vivre une odyssée spatiale rocambolesque! 
Le Shack politique commencera dans 3...2...1...0!

title: The ACSS Podcast
description:
The ACSS Podcast explores topics highly relevant to Australia’s evolving national security issues. In September 2023, a competitive application process will result in over 80 high-caliber delegates being selected from a variety of fields. Currently in its fourth year, the ACSS will host hubs in capital cities across Australia and a US team based out of Washington DC. Delegates will face three intense and realistic crisis simulations exploring domestic, regional, and non-traditional national security dilemmas. These podcast episodes will assist our delegates to prepare for summit week while also informing our wider audience of evolving issues relating to Australia’s national security.

All past and current members of the ACSS team would like to acknowledge that this podcast is being recorded on the traditional lands of the Ngunnawal and Ngambri people and pay our respects to the elders past, present, and emerging. We also acknowledge the traditional custodians of each of our delegate hubs where many of our listeners will be based. You are listening to the podcast produced by the Australian Crisis Simulation Summit. We are a volunteer student-led organisation who create and run complex futuristic and alternative crisis simulations in a national effort to help create the next generation of national security experts and leaders.

We hope you enjoy this series.

https://australiancrisissimulationsummit.com/

title: Onderwijsheid
description: 'Onderwijsheid' is een podcast platform, waarop urgente en actuele verhalen over onderwijs worden verteld. Zena Bani, docent pedagogiek aan de iPabo en voorheen showhost bij De Krachtige Leraar Podcast, neemt jullie mee op onderzoek door in gesprek te gaan met een breed scala aan sprekers. description: Sonic Stories is a show where guests share their favorite songs and the stories behind them. Maybe it's motivated them to play their best game, helped them work through a tough life event, reminds them of a loved one, or just helps them get through the day. What's your jam?

title: The Antebellum Diaspora Project
description: I am descended from American-born enslaved people from North and South Carolina. Many of my ancestors were among the 2.5 million people of African descent who were forcibly migrated and permanently separated from their families. The Antebellum Diaspora Project is a descendent reunification project with a focus on reconnecting families, amplifying the humanity of people who were enslaved during the antebellum era, and sharing negated American history through the perspectives of the people who were most deeply affected by forced migration during the antebellum era in the US.

title: Please Expand
description:
Please Expand is a podcast where I discuss non-fiction books with their authors. But Please Expand is not just about summaries; it's about conversations. I go into every episode having read each book in great detail and having reflected on the fundamental assumptions, foundations and questions with which the book grapples.
If you, like me, have finished a book with burning questions that only the author could answer, then Please Expand is the podcast for you.
Pick up one of the books I'm discussing and settle in for what I hope will be an illuminating conversation.

title: It's a Brown Thing
description:
It’s a Brown Thing is….
A platform to bring together the next generation of South Asian youth. This is our podcast page where we post content about South Asian culture and expand on what it means to be a part of the South Asian diaspora. Our creators are people who you can relate to, young South Asian bi-cultural people who are willing to represent the experience, advocate for our issues, and help our own culture learn from and adapt in the most ethical and helpful ways.

title: Big Trip - Tracking New Connections
description:
THE BIG TRIP - A curatorial movement tracking new connections to the rooted practices and ancestral wisdoms around the world and linking them to a plural web that supports a more holistic global narrative.

We are a group of curators, each with their own skillset, combining to share and transform knowledge on three pillars: 

- Purposeful sound practice
- The pilgrimage trip
- The rituals of handing down

Drawing together specialists, practitioners, communities and curators from around the world, we are sharing stories through modern media – podcasts, online media, articles, exhibitions and ultimately a forum – to create artistic transformation through international exchange.

​​Four story snippets are juxtaposed and interwoven in this listening experience, providing you with a glimpse of first-hand interviews and completed narratives composed together by conversation setters and people in front of them.  Full-length podcast series will release throughout 2021/2022 on Big Trip online platform.

title: slobodnim stilom
description:
U ovom ćemo podcastu slobodnim stilom razgovarati s gostima ili sami o stilistici, njezinim najpoznatijim granama, književnoj i lingvističkoj stilistici, kao i o primjenjivosti stilistike kao discipline na različitim tekstovima i suradnji s drugim disciplinama, poput retorike, semiotike, sociologije, fonetike, analize diskurza itd.
Na kraju svake epizode naši će gosti odgovarati na sedam pitanja i tako ostaviti svoj stilski potpis. Zanimat će nas najdraže stilske figure, koji biste novi interpunkcijski znak predložili, koju pjesmu znate recitirati napamet, koju pjesmu biste voljeli naučiti recitirati, da se možete izražavati samo jednom vrstom riječi, koja bi to bila, za koju hrvatsku riječ smatrate da je neprevodiva, predložite novu riječ koja označava kakav osjećaj, a koja nije dijelom hrvatskoga rječnika.
Moderatorice:
slobodnim stilom s gostom - Gabrijela Bionda
slobodnim stilom od A do Ž - Iva Antičević, Ana Žagmešter
Kontrasti - Ana Juradin, Helena Lučić

description: Samen met Daniël Muijs duiden we met elkaar wekelijks de zin en de onzin achter de trends, de gebaande paden en de gewoonten in het onderwijs. title: Sotsiaalhääling
description: Sotsiaalhääling on sotsiaalvaldkonnast kõnelev podcast info ja ideede ammutamiseks tulevaste ja praeguste sotsiaalvaldkonna töötajate, kuid ka laiemalt kõigile, kes sotsiaalvaldkonna vastu huvi tunnevad.  Saate külalisteks on erineva taustaga põnevad ja inspireerivaid inimesed, kellega koos arutleda sotsiaalvaldkonna arengute ja võimaluste üle. Eelkõige on eesmärk tekitada lahendustele ja inspiratsioonile orienteeritud arutelusid. Räägime küll konstruktiivselt sellest, mis vajab arendamist, kuid samas unistame ja mõtleme kastist välja - loome väärtust läbi arutelude! title: Testmens
description: TESTMENS van de veiligheidsdienst is een podcast in 5 delen, elke week een aflevering met het persoonlijke verhaal van een Nederlandse man die door  de veiligheidsdienst gebruikt wordt... om op te oefenen.  Dit verzin je niet.  Dit testmens is een proefkonijn die zonder zijn toestemming gebruikt wordt voor de  praktische oefeningen van aankomende agenten, en voor de ontwikkeling van een nieuwe techniek om te verhoren. Hoe kan je dat bewijzen? Zoveel toevalligheden, zoveel voorbeelden, dat het waar is. #ditverzinjeniet

title: Feminist in Progress: Gaining Perspective, Losing Hatred
description: In “Feminist in Progress: Gaining Perspective, Losing Hatred”, we take an introspective look at feminism at Gonzaga University, interviewing female leaders about world-wide issues that take place on our small campus in Spokane, Washington. We try to understand where they came from, where they want to go, and how their definition of feminism came to be.

title: The Nadeem Podcast
description:
The Nadeem Podcast is a weekly show hosted by Nadeem, a curious and inquisitive individual with a passion for learning and sharing knowledge. In each episode, Nadeem explores a different topic in depth, drawing on his own experiences and research to provide listeners with a unique and insightful perspective. Whether you're interested in current events, history, science, or anything in between, you're sure to find something to enjoy on The Nadeem Podcast.

Here are some things you can expect from The Nadeem Podcast:

  • Thought-provoking conversations about a variety of topics

  • In-depth research and analysis

  • A unique and insightful perspective

  • A conversational and inviting tone

  • A commitment to accuracy and fairness

If you're looking for a podcast that will challenge your thinking, broaden your horizons, and make you laugh, you must listen to The Nadeem Podcast. Subscribe today and join the conversation!

title: Uncharted Geography
description: Mapping the world, one conversation at a time.

title: Voices From Peripheries: Voices of Resistance
description: Have you ever asked yourself if terms such as general truth or universal knowledge make any sense? Whose history are we learning at school? And How much of human knowledge are we missing? Why are the voices of vast parts of the world silenced? Or at best remembered in wars, natural disasters or in a postcard as an object of exotism? How does the world look like from the so-called peripheries? Voices from the peripheries is a podcast about decolonizing knowledge and mind. My name is Amira Benali. I am from Tunisia and I have been working in Europe Universities for the last ten years. Like many of you, I aspire to contribute to the social justice and equality efforts. In this podcast, I will invite scholars, students and activists worldwide to discuss topics such as cultural dominance, decolonial feminism, food sovereignty, Islamophobia, and indigenous knowledge among other topics. If like me, you feel angry when you look at your school curriculum, if you believe that we have a lot to learn from minorities and people in the peripheries, then this podcast is for you! Music: ©Hamza Bouchnak & Nassim Ben Rhouma, Nouba Soundtrack 2020; Original music composed by Hamza Bouchnak & Nassim Ben Rhouma for the Nouba tv show directed by Abdelhamid Bouchnak. title: The Slowing Down Podcast
description: Join an explorer, creator, and post-modern yoga teacher Janna Slow to look at consistent patterns between speeding up and slowing down on personal and global levels. With her guests, Janna examines different forms of stress in our society, talks about body-mind practices, and finds solutions toward more sustainable life. More info on jannaslow.com. Podcast art by @gradolievna.

title: Warfare, Advancement, and Revisionism
description: The goal of this project is to document the history of humanity by documenting all of humanity’s attempts to defeat it’s greatest foe. Itself. This is not going to be a straightforward documentation of kings fighting and destroying each other, though there will be many mentions and examples of that. This will attempt to explain our subjects from the ground up. The common foot soldiers to the leaders at their head. Their strategies, tactics, weapons, and technologies. Their triumphs and tragedies. Their lives and their deaths. What they fought for and why. What motivated them. What drove them.

title: The Dark Matter Myth Podcast
description:
The Dark Matter Myth Podcast, is a triple entendre, play on words. We raise issues that are thought to be of circumstance, but are usually a subconscious, dark afterthought to most people. It also draws inspiration from a concept of the astrophysics field called, Dark Matter.

The Dark Matter phenomenon is only observable by it's pull on nearby objects. While it isn't observable on the visible light spectrum, it's presence is calculated to consist of a significant majority of the entire universe.

In short, the majority of the universe is filled with experiences and circumstances that you will never see. And it all remains a myth until the majority of people believe it to be true. And the only way to do that is to give them the information while they're still.... Receptive.

So come and enjoy this fusion of HipHop, philosophy, street smarts, science and history.

For people without the comic book, Episode 9 is a great place to start. Anything before this is a bit unpolished, but still worth listening to.

This podcast began centered around discussions following the provocative comic book series and corresponding audio works By Jean Kyle R.

The first episode is much different from any of the latest episodes. So if you don't have it, start at episode 9.

The Dark Matter Myth Series is available at: http://www.DarkMatterMyth.com Purchase our two issue collection today for only $7.13. You won't regret it. Also available at Google Books...& Amazon Kindle.

http://linktr.ee/JR.Media https://www.instagram.com/jr.media.comics/ http://mailto:Jr.Media.comics@gmail.com https://www.tiktok.com/darkmatter_comics.media

description:
Welcome to the Kinky Podcast, hosted by Derrick Monnie.


A Dating Coach, a Sex Educator, and a Non-Monogamous Relationship Expert, Derrick Monnie will be your Carnal Concierge as we discuss polyamory, throuples, swinging, threesomes, BDSM, role-play, exploring kinks, self-confidence, and any other hedonistic pleasure you can think of.

Join us as we look at how everyday objects and seemingly straightforward topics can all reveal deeper questions about how to advance better policy and move among one another with greater compassion and curiosity.

description:
يقدّم الموسم الأول من برنامج "موازين"، رؤية وتفسيراً وإجابةً على سؤال: كيف نفهم العالم؟

تفسير ينطلق من رؤية جيوسياسية، يفسر فيها الوقائع والأحداث الدائرة في منطقتنا والعالم من حولنا، ليخرج بمنهجية واضحة، لفهم أوسع وادراك أكبر لمعنى تحالفات الدول وصراعاتها ومصالحها وكذلك الأمن القومي للدول، وما ارتباط ذلك ببعضه بعضًا؟ وكيف يؤثر علينا نحن في العالم العربي؟ كيف نفهمه كما هو الآن؟ وكيف نتوقعه للمستقبل حتى لا نتفاجأ وحتى لا نضلل!

title: Challenging Colonialism
description: Challenging Colonialism amplifies Indigenous perspectives on issues of concern to native Californian communities. It is our intention to create an educational resource where everyone can hear the perspectives of Indigenous peoples in their own words. It is not our intention to further colonize the narrative, or to misrepresent stories that are not our own. The podcast is produced by Martin Rizzo-Martinez, Historian, & Daniel Stonebloom, a Public School Administrator.

title: Intervenciones Gringas
description: Historia de las intervenciones estadounidenses en Latinoamérica y el mundo. Exploramos las historias detras todos los golpes del estado, guerras, y bombardeos que hizo Estados Unidos para construir su imperio. con Jeremy y Tess!

title: Floating Bridges
description:
In de driedelige serie van Floating Bridges wordt er opnieuw licht geworpen op Curaçao’s autonome status binnen het Nederlandse Koninkrijk. 

Tijdens hun onderzoek, gaan Lusette Verboom en Stephanie van Heijningen gesprekken aan met verschillende experts in hun vak, om na te gaan of de autonome status van Curaçao, ruim 10 jaar sinds haar inwerkingtreding, gevolgen heeft gehad op de politieke, economische en sociaal-culturele werkelijkheid op het eiland.

Het doel van Floating Bridges is om gesprekken teweeg te brengen en creative expressie te stimuleren over de ontwikkelingen op het eiland, zodat de kloof tussen kunst en werkelijkheid overbrugt kan worden.

Met dank aan  ex-premier van de voormalige Nederlandse Antillen en voormalig minister van Curaçao, Suzy Camelia-Römer, mr. Mirto Murray, prof. Rose Mary Allen, rector magnificus Francis de Lanoy en Dr. Rob van den Berg, voor hun samenwerking met dit project. Ook met dank aan Mathijs Reinen voor het beschikbaar stellen van de muziek.
Omslagillustraties door Pater Brenneker en Elis Juliana.

Dit project is mogelijk gemaakt door het Mondriaan Fonds.

title: Questions You Didn't Ask
description: The purpose of this podcast is to uncover the questions we didn’t ask, to break silence and isolation, and to some extent confront our own ignorance which has led many of us to express stigma, conjure fear, and rely on avoidance as defense mechanisms which oftentimes leads to poor health and sometimes death.

title: Mi Última Neurona
description: El propósito de este podcast es llevar información gratuita y valiosa a la comunidad hispana, que tiene acceso limitado al complejo mundo de la neurociencia debido a las barreras del idioma y la subrepresentación en las ciencias. También pretende inspirar a la próxima generación de neurocientíficos hispanos. Jessica Chomik, la host y productora del podcast, es una investigadora en el Instituto Tecnológico de Massachusetts, o mejor conocido como MIT. Ella trabaja en los laboratorios de la Dra. Nancy Kanwisher y la Dra. Laura Schulz.

title: Erik Thor | The Flow Code Podcast
description: Discover the 16 Personalities and the work of Carl Jung like never before and learn how I connect the study of personality types to flow and motivation. Get practical and real advice on how you can grow and develop your personality.

title: Bunker's Cable
description:
Welcome to Bunker’s Cable. A biweekly podcast from The Matthew B. Ridgway Center for International Security Studies at the University of Pittsburgh. The core mission of the Ridgway Center is to contribute to the intellectual and policy debates about the world’s most pressing issues in international security studies. The Ridgway Center focuses on a diverse range of challenges to international security — including the spread of international terrorism, counterinsurgency, the rise of transnational organized crime, the proliferation of nuclear weapons, emerging technology, and other critical issues faced by policymakers and the U.S. military. 
Named after the man best remembered for salvaging the United Nations’ efforts during the Korean War as the commander in chief of the UN troops. Gen. Matthew Bunker Ridgway was also the chief of staff for the US army during the Vietnam war, and of course the inspiration behind the name Bunker’s Cable. Each episode we will delve into a topic within international security, speaking to professors about their research, commenting on current events, and discussing policy options. We want to highlight academic research while connecting the findings to current events. Our goal is to make today’s research accessible to you.

title: Global China Today
description:

We are a podcast group hosted by University College London students bringing you the newest international perspective on economic and political affairs every week. We also interview leading scholars to bring you the brightest voices of the brightest minds.

title: Awarecast
description: Awarecast deals with information security risks that you might encounter in your day-to-day life. In each episode a specialist from the field will be interviewed about recognizable, everyday situations. How do you become more aware of information security threats in a fast changing digital landscape? Even more importantly, how do we create a more resilient information society? This podcast is hosted by Awareways, specialist in cultural and behavioral change in security awareness and privacy. Would you like to know more? Check out the website: https://awareways.com/

title: ParkerParker Podcast
description: Wide-ranging talks and conversation without limit and certainly with an eye towards building a better tomorrow for everyone's sake.

title: IPeers Research Series Podcast
description:
The IPeers Research Seminar Series Podcast is a short and sweet podcast where the members of IPeers interview their seminar series guests and quiz them about the origins of their research ideas, the writing process, and their life as a researcher.

IPeers is organized by researchers at the Legal Studies Department at the Central European University (CEU). It brings together students, researchers, and faculty from inside and outside CEU which share an interest in IP and IT law, law & innovation, law & technology, and related disciplines.

title: Relevate Presents: Scholars Ship
description:
“Ship” (v): 1. To have a strong interest in the romantic relationship of characters from fictional stories. 2. The desire for two or more fictional characters to become a romantic couple.“Ship” (n): 1. a vessel larger than a boat for transporting people or goods by sea.

But really… We all know Hollywood doesn’t always portray love realistically; however, we still have our favorite tv show and movie couples that make us feel a sense of connection, hope, admiration, or just utter annoyance. Join your host Dr. Eric Goodcase as he talks with scholars to analyze, scrutinize, and humanize your favorite (and least favorite) fictional couples. You can follow the podcast on twitter @relevatepodcast or email us at relevatepodcast@gmail.com If you are interested in Relevate and want to receive research based information about relationships you can become a part of Relevation Nation by checking out our social media: Facebook -facebook.com/myrelevate Twitter -@MyRelevate

Get in touch to find out how we can help YOU to be a force to be reckoned with, or just stop by and listen. You're very welcome.

title: ASTRAL SOUL LIGHTNING
description: Albert Einstein said, “The most beautiful thing we can experience is the mysterious. It is the source of all true art and science.” Big subjects, so a little about me... Best-selling author, Broadway, creative master, and profiled by the Washington Post, and New Republic. I've experienced the mysterious... This podcast is that lifelong journey. Been interviewed by national outlets, print and television, "Relationship Consultant" for the LA Weekly (first online writing was in 1996), with a Bachelor of Fine Arts from Stephens College. A recovering political op-ed writer. (Kidding. My stint in politics has lasted a lifetime.) This podcast is an exploration of what I’ve witnessed, and how authentic creativity works... Experience led me to the roadmaps and mythology of planets and stars, forcing me to consider astrology and the synchronicity between what’s above and what humans experience on Earth. A topic Carl Jung excavated his entire career. To challenge 2,000-year-old traditional Christianity and mythology that’s been co-opted by political extremists. To accept there’s more to life than what is seen… The first time I had an out-of-body experience I was looking at myself fall down a winding wood staircase from the second floor. Scared shitless, told no one. This came after, as a kid, I saw my dead father’s spirit from across the room. Discovered clairvoyance is a human byproduct of deep knowing. Since I was young, instincts have guided my life. Real magic is something I’ve witnessed and experienced. Miracles are too. This podcast is philosophy for the Aquarian Age. A way to expand our idea about who we are, why we’re here and how to tap into energies swirling around us and above... Raised in the Christian faith, mysterious events unleashed in my life as a child and throughout my life obliterated my mom's religious teachings. After 2,000 years of Christian mythology, it’s time for a spiritual reformation. Religion isn't required. Faith is. Postscript: I hope you subscribe. We're all in this together. Thanks for listening.

title: Gunslinger 不曾遠去的硝煙
description:

title: The View From My Middle Finger
description:
Welcome to this new podcast series, The view from my Middle finger, where we take a look at the world through the many, social media platforms.

With 3 seasons now streaming, we deliver a mix of entertainment in each series.

Series 1- The View From My Middle Finger- we cover many different topics which are highlighted through social media and the internet.
We look at the absurd side of society, the changing landscape and how we all navigate our way through the obstacles, in our own individual way.
With a healthy does of scepticism and humour, in some cases we highlight the illogical and the ridiculous.

Season 2- The Celebrity I Didn't Interview- In this short series we virtually interview some well known celebrities.

Season 3- AI Independent News- Who said that you need humans to deliver the news, well here at AI Independent News, we say to hell with humans, as our team of AI reporters deliver the news in their own inimitable style.
If you don't trust main stream media, then why not give AI Independent News a listen to, AI reporters deliver the news without the bullshit, as they are machine learning and haven't learnt bullshit yet. 

The View From My Middle Finger is sponsored by Tee Public, check out our merchandise in our Tee Public Store- https://www.teepublic.com/stores/the-view-from-my-middle-finger?ref_id=26524

title: De Zoektocht van een Generatie
description:
In de podcast ‘de Zoektocht van een Generatie’ gaat Froukje Jackson samen met de luisteraar op zoek naar thema’s die leven bij ‘de Millennial’ (±geboren tussen 1980/1985 en 2000). Froukje is werkzaam als GZ-psycholoog en Zorginnovator bij Maarsingh en van Steijn Groningen.

In verschillende afleveringen wordt, zowel binnen in de spreekkamer als in de samenleving, gezocht naar uitdagingen en mogelijkheden van deze twintigers en dertigers. De term ‘vooruitstruikelen’ staat hierbij centraal. Deze boeiende gesprekken zijn onderlegger voor een online trainingsmodule: een gereedschapskist om psychische gezondheid te bevorderen en te verbeteren.

https://www.maarsinghenvansteijn.nl/groningen/

title: Roots to Reason
description: Roots to Reason was created by six University of Montana students who are a part of the Franke Global Leadership Initiative. This environmental podcast series uses research and interviews from people in the Missoula area with diverse backgrounds to demonstrate how people's beliefs, biases, and upbringing influence their interactions with the environment. Through reflecting on these conversations and oneself, the goal is for our listeners to develop an environmental self-awareness and sense of belonging in a global context. Listen closely as we get to the roots of what informs people's opinions about the environment that surrounds them.
author_name: Sierra Franklin, Sarah Giffin, Cara Shepard, Damara Stewart, Rowan Ulrigg, and Abby Vogt

title: What Do You Understand?
description: Global Partners for Development proudly presents “What Do You Understand?” A deep dive into the many facets of philanthropy and development. Experts in their field will discuss an aspect of their work that they understand particularly well. Let’s talk about big bets, innovation, social enterprises, large scale humanitarian aid and the fixation on “ending things” or “solving humanity’s greatest problems” and the issues that arise while tackling it all.

title: Cultivated Space: DU Native Histories
description: Hello Everyone! I am Reshawn Edison, your host for this series. Cultivated Space reflects my Capstone project as an undergraduate student at the University of Denver Anthropology Department. I explore the reckoning between Indigenous identity In higher education by those who have a relationship with the university. As a predominantly white institution, the University of Denver has upheld an unjust climate within its structure and culture. DU has maintained a hostile academic environment that Native American scholars and their allies constantly struggle with. I highlight these forms of navigation at a collective level. Join me as we validate Indigenous Identity because our relations narrative is critical to making actual change. This project is dedicated to the University of Denver Indigenous community, our allies, and extended relatives. To all my Indigenous peers across Turtle Island in higher education: Our voice, experiences, and stories matter.

title: Se dice de mí - Podcast constituyente

¡Síguenos!

title: Putting a Face (and Voice) with Disability
description:
The Halle Grace Foundations presents a new series in which I interview individuals diagnosed with disabilities, in the podcast, "Putting a Face with Disability."  Through these podcasts, we allow individuals to use their voice and share their story of how their diagnosis has impacted their life.  These amazing humans open their hearts to us as they share the psychological, social, emotional, and vocational impact disability has had on their lives. They have chosen to use their voice to change others' perception of disability, in turn, creating a more inclusive world.  We hope you enjoy hearing their stories.  

These podcasts were developed as part of the University of South Florida's new, online graduate course, Medical & Psychosocial Aspects of Disability as part of their new, fully, online master's program, Rehabilitation Counseling and Disability Sciences (RCDS).

title: The Psych NP Podcast
description: The Psych NP Podcast is all about being a psychiatric nurse practitioner in different environments and working with different populations. I have had the privilege to work with and know some of the finest PMHNPs around, and in each episode we explore what it's like to work in that setting. The work we do is real and so are the conversations in each episode. If you've found this podcast, you were either assigned it :), have an interest in this type of work, or do this job everyday, and are looking for camaraderie. Thank you so much for the work you do and to our guests in each episode. I hope you enjoy!

Opowiadamy o językach i o języku samym w sobie z wielu różnych perspektyw: - teoretycznej i deskryptywnej, tj. w formie analizy realnie używanego języka w sposób neutralny, bez normatywnego wartościowania jego elementów, - historycznej, kulturowej i antropologicznej, - fonologicznej, składniowej i semantycznej, - nawet filozoficznej, - a od czasu do czasu – humorystycznej.

title: Who Holds Up Half the Sky
description:
“Who Holds up Half the Sky” is an investigative podcast discussing the possibilities of advancing feminist activism in China under censorship and lack of free speech. Influential activist figures appear in China’s history from the Qing dynasty to the Maoist era with its famous quote: “Women Hold up Half the Sky”. But Chinese women have undergone much pressure from foot binding and arranged marriages to unequal pay and domestic violence. Over the years, I have dived deeper into issues of multiculturalism, social activism, and gender identities. This work defines my curiosity which stems from a continuous movement through distinct cultural spaces, which started in China.

You can read more about the podcast, and the research for it, as well as listen to the full interviews and the full-length podcast here: andreeacoscai.com/2020/09/09/sound-projects/

Cover art by Meaghan Paine
Mixing by Jullian Androkae

title: BRIDGES Podcast Series
description:
Migration has become a polarising issue in European public and political debates, which are often determined by interpretations rather than raw facts. These interpretations are the result of certain narratives on migration, but what do we mean by "narrative"? And what makes some narratives dominant over others? The BRIDGES Podcast Series covers the production and impact of migration narratives in different public and political spheres, such as the media, civil society and policymaking. This series brings together experts from the project's consortium and the actors involved in narratives' production and impact in each of these spheres. 

BRIDGES is a research project funded by the European Union’s Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme under grant agreement no.101004564. The contents of these podcasts are the sole responsibility of the authors and do not necessarily reflect the views of the European Union. The European Commission and the European Research Executive Agency are not responsible for any use that may be made of the information these podcasts contain.

title: We Should Probably Be Studying
description:
Sometimes, especially as Ph.D. students and assistant faculty members, it's hard to feel like you are truly “joining the conversation” with highly esteemed scholars in your area of research. Join Paula and Nick, two students at the University of North Texas who are trying to earn a Ph.D. in business management, every week as they discuss a new research article with the experts who actually conducted the research. 

In this podcast, We Should Probably Be Studying, Paula and Nick are literally “joining the conversation” with top-publishing scholars to help new researchers, or simply curious listeners, understand what conversations are taking place in the management and organization literature. Paula and Nick hope to provide an outlet that guides new scholars, such as Ph.D. students and rising assistant faculty members, through interpreting the research being conducted in our top journals, generating research ideas for future publication, and getting publishing advice from those who have demonstrated the ability to do so already. 

Each week, Paula and Nick focus on one recently published work in either Administrative Science Quarterly, Academy of Management Journal, Strategic Management Journal, or Journal of Management and interview the authors of that article to gain insight into their backgrounds as scholars, how they work together, what roadblocks they encountered during the research project, the review process, and much more!

title: Abolish Psych (For a Better Future)
description:
This Marxist feminist podcast critiques and examines the modern profession of psychiatry from a Marxist perspective. We view mental health in a state a public health crisis caused by the collective trauma of capitalism. The mental health industry in the US largely serves to uphold capitalist power structures and manage reactions to capitalist oppression. The series starts off with an overview and discussion of the book Psychiatric Hegemony which critiques the power structure of mental health professionals and the profit motive of the pharmaceutical industry. Future discussions may center around teach ins, collective trauma, public mental health education, community mental health, personal experiences, scientific research, mental health behaviors, neurodiversity, or other topics related to liberation from the current model of psychiatry.

While we do recognize the pain and suffering at the individual level and that individuals have benefitted from interventions within the mental health care system, this podcast is best suited for individuals ready to critique the power structure and imagine the future of mental health from a revolutionary perspective. This podcast will touch high-level on many potentially triggering topics including but not limited to sexuality, violence, racism, misogyny, substance use, and any number of atrocities.

description: If horror is your thing, listen to Horror Study Hall: the academic side of horror.  Where we examine research, books, and podcasts that study the horror genre.

title: Education Rx
description:
Education has reached a tipping point: we cannot use outdated practices and expect students to thrive. Education Rx was born out of a desire to support change in the public education system. Education should be engaging, have real world value, and be equitable for ALL students; no matter race, socio-economic status, or ability level.  And, it should be FREE!
We don't have all the answers, but we are searching out experts and real people that hold a piece of the puzzle, and we will be giving them a chance to share their perspective on what is broken.  Then we will follow it up with what is WORKING! We want to help start conversations that will help us move towards educational reform that will move our nation's public education system forward.
The students of today are the leaders of tomorrow.  Education should be one of the MOST important institutions in our country! We can do better.  Join us. Start conversations.  WE CAN DO BETTER!

title: The MindWorks Podcast
description: The MindWorks Podcast is the podcast that will help enhance your knowledge and perception in mental health, psychology, and philosophy. Two Latino mental health professionals from NY discuss the field of mental health from their perspective.

title: Retrógrades
description:
Un intento por conceptualizar el presente, por ensayar ideas que nos sugiere algún suceso de actualidad, por fuera de las simpatías y antipatías de los grupetes.

Somos:
Alejandro Grimoldi, experiodista "cultural", actual ensayista y traductor de inglés, francés e italiano
Ignacio De Marinis, profesor de Filosofía y afines en Universidad Austral, UCEMA y otras
Tomás Binder, crítico de cine y profesor de Cine y Filosofía en la Universidad del Cine

Grabamos este podcast con Zencastr.
author_name: Alejandro Grimoldi, Ignacio De Marinis y Tomás Binder

title: Misbehave
description: In the Misbehave podcast, we explore human behaviour in a business context. We’ll show you how leading with a deeper behavioural insight is the key to positively impacting people, performance, and profit. Because misbehaving isn’t about doing something wrong or not conforming. It’s the fact that you may be missing key opportunities to motivate and engage with people by missing behavioural insight. In this podcast, we’ll share more about how to understand behavioural patterns of yourself and those around you. We’ll tell stories we’ve experienced and the tools to use to flex behaviour. This will give you the power to influence and elevates your business to a completely new level. Let’s misbehave. ... Follow Laura: https://www.instagram.com/iamlauraelizabethw/ Follow Sarah: https://www.instagram.com/iamsarahcallender/ Find out more: https://duoglobalconsulting.com/

title: 呒趣向turntable
description: 大家好，欢迎来到「呒趣向turntable」，这是两个「晃膀子」的宁波人制作的独立播客。在之后的节目里，我们希望通过书籍、音乐、电影的榫卯结构，在日常中制造惊喜，搭建现代生活中的庇护所。每月19号中午固定更新（不定期掉落建材）。

title: Mind Matters Presented by Light 4 Change
description: Let's talk about things that are happening in our communities, where change can be made for the better, helpful hits on living a positive life, and getting to know the resources in your community. Lets talk about Mental health, Generational Trauma, Amber Alerts for missing children, Racism, Bullying, Modern Capitalist Slavery, Resources in the Community. If you are comfortable talking about these sensitive topics and how it could be changed in positive ways this is the place for you.

title: Tall Poppy Talk
description:
Tall Poppy Syndrome, it's a social phenomenon, we all know, but don't often unpack. Kia ora, my name is Grace Lewis and I am on a mission to change the conversation around tall poppy syndrome. By focusing on the positives, rather than weaponising people's success, we can grow more Tall Poppies and fuel a culture that is based on genuine celebration of people's achievements.  
Join me as I interview legendary people who are [tall poppies] in their field, about their experience - & the lessons they've learned along the way.

title: A Rational Truth
description:
Politics, Philosophy and Psychology Podcast. We're exploring the absurdities of existence in today's world and asking key philosophical questions about society and culture today. We're investigating the Meaning, Purpose and Value of life. Hosted by Adele C Marsh MCIPD, Transformational Leader, Philosopher, Productivity Activist and Entrepreneur.

"Season 1: An Introduction to Philosophy" commenced on 3rd December 2022 and is a series of 24 introductory topics in Human Philosophy, in bite-sized 20 minute podcasts with accompanying Blog posts.

title: The Intangible
description: The Intangible is a podcast discussing cultural preservation in the modern world. From statues, to music, to cancel culture, to literature- The Intangible focuses on every aspect of modern culture. Cultural Preservation is normally discussed in the context of history and ancient archaeological artifacts. But, what about our current culture? What are the controversial aspects of our culture? Do we even want to preserve some parts? These are some of the questions that The Intangible aims to answer through discussions with many opinionated guests with focuses in different fields of culture and cultural preservation. For more information, check out the website: https://www.theintangible.co/

title: Sfertul Academic  –  podcasturi de antropologie
description: Sfertul Academic este un proiect editorial digital care aduce împreună cercetători din științele sociale, actori și artiști ilustratori cu scopul de a populariza antropologia, oferind publicului larg acces la resurse fundamentate teoretic și înrădăcinate în cercetări de teren aprofundate, care de regulă au o circulație limitată la comunitatea academică. Apărută în anul 2020, colecția de debut a platformei Sfertul Academic reunește contribuțiile a 37 de cercetători din științele sociale, 13 ilustratori și 2 actori și cuprinde 40 de articole, fiecare dintre ele însoțite de versiunea podcast și de o ilustrație inspirată din conținutul textului. Temele abordate pun în lumină concepte centrale din teoria antropologică, cum ar fi: ordine morală, structură și agentivitate, cultură materială, relații de putere, relații de schimb, sisteme de cunoaștere, gen, identitate, sine și societate. Totodată, aduc perspective noi asupra unor subiecte familiare, de actualitate: mediu, migrație, inegalități sociale, privatizare, dezvoltare personală, turism, și altele. Nu în ultimul rând, dezvăluie lumi sociale mai puțin cunoscute, din România, dar și de peste hotare: Egipt, Ghana, Japonia, Rusia sau Abhazia sunt doar câteva dintre locurile pe care ni le aduc mai aproape cercetările incluse în acest volum digital. Celor 40 de articole publicate li se adaugă o nouă serie de 60 de materiale originale, pe același format: text, podcast și ilustrație, care vor fi publicate în intervalul ianuarie 2022 - mai 2023. Sfertul Academic este un proiect al start-up-ului de cercetare socială Antropedia, cofiinanțat de AFCN, inițiat și coordonat de Maria Rădan-Papasima. Coperta colecției este realizată de Alexandru Nimurad.

title: Sag mal Abi
description: "Sag mal Abi" ist der ideale Podcast für alle, die auf der Suche nach verständlichen Erklärungen aktueller Trends im IT-Sektor sind. Maher Hamid und Okan Erkaptan, zwei Experten im Bereich der IT, bieten in jeder Folge einen tiefen Einblick in die Welt der Informationstechnik und beleuchten dabei auch die möglichen Auswirkungen von Machine Learning und Künstlicher Intelligenz auf die Gesellschaft in der Zukunft. "Sag mal Abi" ist somit der perfekte Podcast für alle, die sich für die neuesten Trends in der IT-Welt und die Auswirkungen von Technologie auf unsere Gesellschaft interessieren. Hören Sie rein und lassen Sie sich von Maher Hamid und Okan Erkaptan durch die Welt der IT-Trends führen.

title: luminati.be
description:
Verhalen over oude en nieuwe complottheorieën, pseudowetenschap en desinformatie.
Per maand één onderwerp, in één of meerdere episodes.

title: Rise
description: Rise is a series of audio articles hosted by author Aude Calloch, treating subjects of sociology, psychology, health, history, philosophy and more. All episodes are available in written form at www.audecalloch.com, in the 'Articles' section.

title: Redefining Masculinity
description: Redefining Masculinity is an action project led by research assistants based around the key findings of Adam Howard’s newest study which goes into the secret worlds of American elite all-boys schools. Through the eyes of 127 recent alumni, we see the practices and relations involved in making privileged boys into elite men and the central role of privileged brotherhoods in this process. Several research assistants have worked alongside Howard not only to conduct this study but also to gain valuable insights into what we’ve learned from this research. In order to highlight student researchers’ perspectives and engage with the studies findings, pairs of students collaborated to produce a podcast series entitled Redefining Masculinity. Each podcast is centered around a main finding of the study. a different finding presented in each of the six chapters of the book. Through these discussions, student researchers put the data to use to explore various aspects of these secret worlds.

title: Dock Talk
description: Dock Talk is a podcast created by Maritime Professionals & Experts for Maritime Professionals & Experts. Want a community who asks and answers all of the industries questions? Well now you have it. Tune into Dock Talk once a month and stay up-to-date on the happenings in our industry!

title: Wildly Queerious
description: Humanists Dr. Corinne Votaw, PsyD, and Brittany Freer, MA, use their mental health and healing training to frame conversations on queer theory, religion, politics, media, and current events.

title: Drive Me To Your Leader
description:
In this podcast we are going to take on all those controversial topics. There will be arguing, lamenting and hopefully not cursing. 
Either way, Welcome to the Podcast.

title: Croissant Hours
description:
Croissant Hours: 
The show where Croissant shares his insights and knowledge in a free flow format. Enjoy the edgy depths of his ENTP shadow and the absolute stupidity of his ESFP- and the occasional indignant rage of his ISFJ.

At the end of the day he can't and won't shut up, so might as well record it.

title: Everyone’s Weird & So Are You
description: Conversational interview-based real-life storytellers based off of cold calls from all media platforms and personal and professional networking. Talk to strangers more often. Ask deeper questions. You might learn more about yourself in the process.

title: Emotional Education with Dr. Albert Levis
description: Albert Levis, M.D., the inventor of Moral Science, puts his approach into practice at his Museum of Creative Process in Vermont where he connects Formal Theory to the artistic process through exhibitions and workshops. A practicing psychiatrist for over forty years, Levis was trained at the Universities of Zurich and Geneva, the University of Chicago and Yale. In Emotional Education, Dr. Albert Levis discusses Emotional Education for all, the Moral Science Theory, and the Creative Process.

title: Jads Podcast
description:
منصّة تواصليّة بديلة ذات طابع شخصيّ صَداقيّ، مع شخصيّات مُجَدّدة ومثيرة للاهتمام من شريحة طلاب الدكتوراة الفلسطينيين في جامعة تل أبيب. تهتمّ المدوّنة بتسليط الضّوء على أنفسنا وطاقاتنا كجماعة عن طريق منصّات تكشف حيوة الأفراد في الجماعة وتفاصيلها، وبالذات تقديم نموذج طلّاب الدّكتوراة بصورة حقيقيّة تعرض المُرّ والحلو في الحياة الأكاديميّة. بالإضافة لمحاولة المدوّنة تحقيق أهداف عينيّة للطلاب الجامعيّين مثل عرض طرق تعامُل مع العقبات والضّغوطات، فهي أيضًا تساهِم في تكوين صورة الجَماعة ولُحمتها، في السّبيل الى تعزيز الانتماء لها ولثقافتها ولِلُغتها. 

مُقدّم البرنامج هو جاد قعدان – طالب دكتوراة في اللّسانيّات الإدراكيّة وعلوم الثّقافة في جامعة تل أبيب.

Au menu, des jeunes engagés et politisés qui vous partage ce qui les anime ou ce qui les garde éveillé la nuit!

title: Charlas Aleatorias
description: La intención de esta serie es acercar al público en general y, en particular, a l@s estudiantes de licenciatura a los seminarios que organiza el Departamento de Estadística del ITAM. Los episodios son cortos pues son charlas informales que tenemos con los expositores del seminario. El objetivo es dar una oportunidad a los ponentes de platicar de su trabajo en un ambiente mas informal que un seminario y motivar al estudiantado a indagar un poco mas en los temas. Y por qué no, atender con mejor contexto las pláticas de dicho seminario. ¡Disfrutalo!

title: Paradox Institute Podcast
description: The Paradox Institute presents research and commentary on the biology of sex and the differences between males and females in animated videos, articles, and books. Visit us at theparadoxinstitute.com.

description: Análisis social desde la perspectiva contracultural, con la agudeza del taladro

title: WhyWork Podcast
description: The WhyWork Podcast is an organisational strategy session and legal dissection of workplace events that are laced with humour. Your bloggers, Alan, Trajce, and Sara, explore the contemporary and uncomfortable realities of work and the boundaries that are tested. Alan and Trajce dismantle case law and Sara pushes all to consider how to redesign the world of work so that business objectives are realised and that people thrive. Good stories are told. The WhyWork team throws shade on some of the stories and the people involved as they consider defensible and remarkable work design strategy. When you listen to the WhyWork Podcast, you realise that no skeleton in the workplace closet is too sacred to unearth. It’s like listening to the water cooler gossip but then shit gets real, and it all becomes serious – fast. This is a must-listen for executive and emerging managers, work design strategists, human factors specialists and ergonomists, work health safety and law specialists, organisational scientists, occupational health academics, and anyone humoured by office and workplace antics! Get ready to exclaim, “She said WHAT...?” and “He DIDN’T! OMG!”. Laugh along with us while you learn lots.
author_name: Alan Girle, Trajce Cvetkvovski, & Sara Pazell

title: Hormonale Tienermeisjes
description:
Norah Delfsma en Hannah Francke, beide leerlingen vwo 6 Nehalennia Breeweg, gaan voor hun profielwerkstuk opzoek naar antwoorden op hun vragen over het vak bewegingsonderwijs. Met als hoofdvraag: wat is de invloed van bewegingsonderwijs op de mentale gesteldheid van middelbare scholieren en hoe lossen we mentale neveneffecten zo goed mogelijk op?

Tijdens hun zoektocht plegen de meiden verscheidene literaire bronnen raad:
https://gedragsproblemenindeklas.nl/gedragsproblemen/faalangst/
https://www.kennisbanksportenbewegen.nl/?file=8967&m=1531747876&action=file.download
https://allesinbeweging.net/storage/2357/2017-Mulier-Instituut---Effecten-sport-&-bewegen-op-basisschool.pdf
http://www.sports-media.be/links/gezond-bewegen-school.pdf
https://dspace.library.uu.nl/bitstream/handle/1874/415277/Rapport_Geluk_onder_druk_DEF_interactief.pdf?sequence=1
https://www.regioplan.nl/wp-content/uploads/2018/12/18102-Effecten-meer-en-beter-bewegingsonderwijs-Regioplan.pdf
http://www.exlo.be/sites/default/files/201811/reader%202010_4.pdf#page=5
http://ond.vvksoict.com/leerplannen/doc/lichamelijke%20opvoeding-2008-005.pdf 
www.scherder.nl



En ook zoeken ze de antwoorden bij ervaringsdeskundigen:
- Jeroen van Aevermate, sportdocent Nehalennia Breeweg
- Tessa Goorsenberg, jeugdverpleegkundige GGD-Zeeland
- Cees Doornbos, leerling vwo 6 Nehalennia Breeweg 
- Dennis Feij, ondersteuningscoördinator 
- Alyssa Hendrix, leerlinge vwo 6 Nehalennia Breeweg

title: The Sex Ed Series
description: Did you have sex education in school? If you were lucky enough to HAVE had it, you may still have hundreds of questions like I always did. And I promise you're not alone — I heard from almost 100 people about their sex education experiences in the United States and across the world, and only a few of them said the education they received left them feeling smarter about their sexual wellbeing. In this short series, I speak with folks from all walks of life, including those who have researched sex education, taught sex education, criticized sex education, praised it, and those who did not have it at all. In order to destigmatize this topic, we need to talk about it. And if that's too scary, we can at least listen to others talk about it, because I learned more than I ever thought I would by doing just that. Sit down, relax, and take a listen. I'm sure you'll learn something too. xox Susie Fordi

title: Agency & Development - Do Individuals Matter?
description: Contemporary international development practice is shaped by politics and extends historical assumptions, concepts and narratives that specify ways of working for professional and practitioners in international and 'local' NGOs. This podcast series explores the theoretical and ethical issues in contemporary development organisations and their discourse, and how development NGO workers are 'captured' by this discourse. A PlanetWorka podcast series - see other PlanetWorka podcast series: Culture & Development - Context Matters!; and, Planetworka - A World in Development

title: Podcast
description: En este Podcast se explorar las implicaciones éticas y sociales de estas teorías, como por ejemplo si es posible responsabilizar moralmente a alguien por sus acciones si estas están totalmente determinadas por factores ajenos a su voluntad y debatidas de la filosofía.

title: He estado pensando
description: "He estado pensando..." es un podcast en el que el sacerdote Alberto Reyes, reflexiona sobre diversos temas de la sociedad actual, desde la política y la cultura hasta la vida cotidiana y las relaciones personales. A través de sus pensamientos, el P. Alberto invita a la reflexión y al diálogo, siempre desde una perspectiva humana y comprometida con la verdad y la libertad. En cada episodio comparte sus ideas con una profundidad y una claridad que invitan a los oyentes a cuestionar su propia visión del mundo y a abrirse a nuevas formas de pensar.

title: Voor je het weet... de podcast
description:
Overdag zijn wij collega’s op een school voor zeer moeilijk lerende kinderen. Marte is psycholoog en Zuzanne is een leerkrachtondersteuner en zelfbenoemde gedragsspecialist. Het zal niemand verbazen dat wij allebei mensen zijn die andere mensen, hun gedachten, gedrag en motivatie erg interessant vinden. Tijdens onze gesprekken zijn we erachter gekomen dat er dingen zijn die wij bijzonder vinden, die voor anderen heel normaal zijn. Deze fascinatie willen we dan ook graag met de buitenwereld delen. Want wij zijn vast niet de enige die hier nieuwsgierig naar zijn. 
Elke aflevering neemt Zuzanne, Marte en de luisteraars mee in een bijzonder iets, dat voor sommige mensen heel normaal is. Ze proberen het fenomeen van verschillende kanten te belichten en willen vooral uit eigen belang zoveel mogelijk van deze bijzondere dingen te weten komen.

title: Let There Be Nous
description: A podcast exploring the intersection of psychology and religion.

title: Intervención Antropológica
description: Bienvenidxs a Intervención antropológica un podcast de divulgación y conocimiento que te permitirá acercarte a diferentes temas de la vida cotidiana desde la mirada calidoscópica de la antropología.

title: Always Learning
description: This podcast is for curious souls who love to learn. I talk about my journey and experiences, as well as things going on in the world that I am learning about.

title: A lo legal: Derecho y actualidad
description:
A lo legal: Derecho y actualidad es un espacio creado por el Departamento de Estudios Jurídicos de la Universidad Icesi con el apoyo de la Organización de Estudiantes de Derecho de Icesi y el Semillero de Transformación Digital, el cual tiene por objetivo ser un canal de interacción entre docentes, estudiantes y la sociedad en general.

Durante los próximos minutos conversaremos con diversos invitados sobre cuestiones de actualidad en el mundo del derecho

Utilizaremos un lenguaje claro, sencillo y ameno, que nos permitirán identificar y explicar los temas relevantes en el mundo del derecho.

title: Giants Amongst Us
description:
Real stories from everyday people. The underdogs, who've beaten the odds, and in their own way, walk like Giants Amongst Us.

_____

Shoot me a line if you'd like to share your story at : giantsamongstus@tutanota.com

The floor is yours!!

title: Kogniceraptor
description: Cześć! Jesteśmy studentami i studentkami kognitywistyki na Uniwersytecie Śląskim w Katowicach. Prowadzimy serię podcastów, w których dzielimy się wiedzą z obszaru filozofii, psychologii, neurobiologii, sztucznej inteligencji a także wielu innych. Usiądź wygodnie i posłuchaj co dla Ciebie przygotowaliśmy!

title: پادکست اقتصاد، بی‌تعارف
description: ما یک تیم داوطلب از اقتصاددانان و فعالان حقوق بشری هستیم که به دور از هرگونه دیدگاه سیاسی و حزبی، با اتکا بر دانشِ اقتصادی خویش و سایر کارشناسان این عرصه به بررسی چالش‌های اقتصاد ایران با هدف ترویج برابری فرصت‌ها در کنار هم مشغول به کار شده‌ایم. محتوای پادکستها و سایر دست‌نوشته‌هایمان به منظور الهام بخشیدن و توانمند نمودن افراد برای ایجاد تغییرات مثبت در جامعه طراحی شده‌است. به باور ما انقلاب زندگی، آزادی، مسیری

title: Edible Oceans
description: Prof. Tony Winson talks to Canadian and world experts on fisheries, ocean ecology, and humanity's impact on marine environments and the ocean species we take for food.

title: Charlas en un Pueblo Fantasma
description: Lo que partió como un Spin Off de Free Solo, hoy se levanta por si mismo y se transforma en un podcast independiente. "Charlas en un Pueblo Fantasma", un lugar de conversación y reflexión sobre diferentes temas relacionados con la sociedad, la psicología y la filosofía en donde convergen los particulares puntos de vista de un comediante y un académico.

title: RAIA(ffairs)
description: ​​We are RAIA(ffairs), your podcast for stepping up in international affairs. Get informed on the stories and worries of political leaders, the 'behind the scenes' of decision-makers, and how politics impact and change your life. Join your hosts Marina and Merel, along with a new guest every episode, to discuss the individual policy-maker of the week.

title: مُر و أحلى
description: بودكاست مُر و أحلى ، منصة رائعة للعلم و المعرفة ، هنا سنتحدث عن كل شيئ هنا عالمك الخاص ، سنستفيد جميعا ان شاء الله من كل علوم الدنيا ، علم النفس ، الطب و الجمال ، التاريخ و الجغرافيا ، المجتمع ، و تجارب الناس و اتمنى ان نكون عند حسن ظنكم ، شكرًا

title: Counter Hegemony
description: Counter-hegemony is a podcast about international politics, globalization, war, peace, crises and social change in the 21st century.

title: Let's Talk Development
description:
The Consortium for Development Policy Research (CDPR) and the International Growth Centre (IGC) are excited to launch their podcast series ‘Let’s Talk Development’.

This is a podcast about understanding Pakistan’s crucial economic and development problems. We engage experts in exploring critical development issues and trends in Pakistan. New episodes come out every two weeks.

The views and opinions expressed in the podcast are those of the speakers and do not necessarily reflect the views or positions of CDPR or any of its affiliates.

title: Tecnografias
description:
Tecnografias é uma nova plataforma de debate transatlântico em redor de livros recentes na área da antropologia e das ciências sociais. Trata-se de um podcast coordenado por um coletivo de antropólogas/os e cientistas sociais sediado em Portugal e no Brasil. Cada episódio é uma conversa e um convite para refletir sobre os grandes desafios do mundo contemporâneo na sua complexidade e pluriversalidade. Disponível nas melhores plataformas de podcasts, incluindo Spotify, Google Podcasts, Apple Podcasts, entre outras. Tecnografias é produzido pela Rede de Pesquisa Internacional Sci-Tech Asia e é apoiado pelo Grupo de Pesquisa "Tecnociência, Sociedade e Ambiente" do CIAS – Centro de Investigação em Antropologia e Saúde da Universidade de Coimbra.

Equipa de Coordenação:

Cristina Sá Valentim, Gonçalo D. Santos, Rodrigo Toniol, e Rosana Castro

Equipa de Produção:

Bruna Coelho, Lívia Humaire

title: GenXed
description:
GenXed is a periodic podcast about life, love, and liberty in 21st century America...with a little burn. 🔥

We read situations and people for what they really are to provide education for the generations.

Join host Tigereye and the occasional guest as we analyze current events, music, movies, and more through a Gen X lens. Take a trip down memory lane every now and then with us and see the world through the eyes of a generation that refuses to die.

title: Relevate Presents: The Reframe
description:
Relevate Presents: The Reframe is a podcast where three friends, who just happen to also be marriage and family therapists, use entertainment mediums such as television and movies to give you unfiltered opinions on the characters with a sprinkle of research and systems theory.

Hosts Chélynn, Marissa, and Carmen welcome listeners into their friend circle and offer a peek into what their group chat looks like on any given day. So buckle up and join them for the journey as they follow the characters from your favorite shows and give you an inside look into what therapists think when they are not in session!

Podcast Sponser: Relevate - myrelevate.com

Podcast Cover Artist: Jacora Smart of The Smart ReMark

Podcast Music: Earnest Adams, III

title: Pisma i Znaki
description:
Co to znaczy istnieć, na czym polega wolność, od czego zależy nasze szczęście, wreszcie – jak ulepszać świat, korzystając z postępu nauki, sukcesów i porażek ludzi, którzy żyli przed nami? Pytania filozoficzne towarzyszą człowiekowi od wieków, także dziś. W audycji Pisma i znaki, razem z gośćmi, rozmawiamy o sprawach, które ciągle są aktualne. Nawiązujemy do historii filozofii, różnych sposobów myślenia o świecie i człowieku. Nie dajemy gotowych odpowiedzi na trudne pytania. Zachęcamy do krytycznego myślenia, twórczej refleksji.

Zaprasza Alicja Karłowska

title: Discern This
description:
Discern This presents unique and entertaining interviews with original thinkers on the most critical issues of the day. Journalist and writer Lonzo Cook engages expert guests in rigorous but relaxed conversations that unpack serious subjects in new and surprising ways. In a relatable yet informed manner, we illuminate some of misapprehensions that the public may hold. By tapping the knowledge of our guests, we intend to surface some of the overlooked causal factors and explore contingencies that may yet happen.

Discern This will range beyond conventional national security debates and explore how technology- especially artificial intelligence- is likely to alter our economies and societies. The podcast intends to provide robust discussions about how environmental and climate concerns should be every society’s priority, and we will cover some innovative potential approaches on how humanity could bend the curve of global warming.

title: Psych Expansion Podcast
description:
Welcome to Psych Expansion, the podcast where we explore the intersections of technology, history, and personal growth. I'm Gabriel, and each week I bring you conversations with everyday people who are seeking understanding to be able to navigate within the challenges and opportunities of our rapidly changing world. My mission with Psych Expansion is to bridge the gap between generations by connecting the knowledge of the youth with the wisdom of the elderly to create a more harmonious world for all. We also discuss the implementation of the latest A.I. technology being introduced in our everyday lives. Share your experiences and insights with us through email or social media, and join us on a journey of self-discovery and growth, the Emotions and Logic rest within the roots. If you're someone who's curious about the world and wants to stay ahead of the curve, join me every Thursday for a new episode of Psych Expansion. I look forward to expanding our minds together.

title: Politics and Pedagogy
description:
We are delighted to launch the first series of “Politics and Pedagogy” a podcast run by the Centre for Teaching Innovation and Scholarship in Politics and International Studies at the University of Leeds. This first series is funded by The COST Action DecolDEV which takes on the challenge to reconstruct the concept and practice of development after its deconstruction. This series showcases conversations from academics in Politics, International Relations and Development as they reflect on decolonial practices in education.

The podcast hosts are Dr Madeleine Le Bourdon Associate Professor in the Politics of Global Development and Dr Louise Pears Lecturer in Global Security Challenges. It is produced by Dr Marine Guéguin and Dr Harrison Swinhoe both Post-doctoral researchers in the Centre for Global Security Challenges.

@CTISLeeds

Funding Provider: This podcast is funded by the EU's Cost Action Decolonising Development (CA19129): www.cost.eu. The Action works towards a resetting and diversification of the structures, institutions and spaces in which knowledge about and for development is produced, shared, contested and put into practice. Decolonisation of knowledge about ‘development’ cannot mean to maintain a paternalist binary of those already developed and those less developed but must scrutinize the structures and institutions that maintain power imbalances and the ideas that support paternalistic relations and assumptions of superiority according to intersectional (read: gendered, racialized, classed etc.) objectification of the Other.
author_name: Madeleine Le Bourdon and Louise Pears

description: At Safe Space, we believe in the power of compassion and its ability to transform lives. We are a team of passionate professionals dedicated to our mission of increasing the quality of life for individuals with autism and related disorders. We understand the challenges faced by those with autism and their families, and we are here to provide support, guidance, and resources to help navigate those challenges. Our approach is grounded in research-backed techniques, and we are committed to sharing our knowledge and insights with the wider community. We believe in creating a safe and inclusive space for all individuals to learn, grow, and thrive. Join us on this mission to explore the infinite possibilities of creating a brighter and more compassionate future for all individuals in the world of ABA.

title: There's More to My Story
description: Humans are interesting creatures. Many of us are convinced that the stories we tell about ourselves are absolute. Maybe it is true…identity is a summation of the stories we tell about ourselves, and each retelling, morphed by experience and interpretation, etches us closer to who we think we are. It is a privilege nonetheless to yield the power of self-determination in free political systems. Not everyone is so blessed. We must not squander the honor we have. In sharing our stories with others, there is a possibility for mosaic activity, for cultivating community. Join us in civic engagement and dialogue as we celebrate diversity, equity, and inclusion.

description:
Welcome to Voices of Democracy! I'm Kevin Sun. This is a podcast created in the context of my integrative project at Sainte-Anne International College, a Quebec CEGEP.

This first series explores the participatory democracy of Quebec and Cuba, and attempts to answer the question: What might Quebec be able to learn from Cuba's popular participation and participatory democracy?

To answer this question, several other subjects are also tackled. What is democracy? What is participation? Tune in to find out.

Rejoignez-nous dans ce voyage pour découvrir des histoires inédites, démêler la désinformation et nous doter des outils nécessaires pour lutter contre les récits qui sèment la discorde aux repas de famille !

Ensemble, nous nous armerons de connaissances, nous chercherons la vérité et nous nous opposerons aux forces qui cherchent à nous diviser, grâce au pouvoir de l'amitié !

title: R-Academy
description:
The R-Academy podcast provides a platform for the democratization of information about highly localized and niche topics. Its host, Robert Contofalsky, firmly believes in the importance of “Open-Access” like platforms where conversations about psychology, history, and science do not have barriers or paywalls behind them. The future of our society depends on the information that we are given at the time, and he believes that this podcast would be a contribution to this overall goal.

The topics discussed on this podcast will start where Robert has the most outreach: academia. He has maintained good relations with many professors and, thus, will begin by conversing with professors in Psychology and history, eventually expanding outwards. However, the “limited” faculty list is not a defect of the podcast, these are world-class scholars that he will be talking to, and the conversations will be nothing short of engaging and insightful. Here is a list of topics that will be covered:

  • The nature of consciousness, language, and communication
  • The Psychology of personality, pain, neuroscience, and Culture
  • The heritability of behaviour and intelligence, and its societal implications
  • Medieval history, translational history; the nature of writing
  • The Cold War and American history

This podcast will concentrate on academic affairs for the time being, with the hope of expanding outwards into more niche domains of scholarly topics. The potential for topics on this podcast will be infinite as professors are never done talking about their work, and that is the beauty of this podcast, is that it will allow the listeners to understand the work of top-shelf experts in a digestible format, and give them the opportunity to continue their curiosities in the topics that are discussed on this podcast.

In sum, the purpose of this podcast is for the host to act like a tourist in the minds and workspace of his guests; it is a zone that is free of judgment, and its primary focus is inquiry.

title: Affihub/Experimentos Sociales
description: Bienvenidos a 'Experimentos Sociales,' un programa que incita a la reflexión y profundiza en las complejidades del comportamiento humano, la cultura y la ética. Cada episodio te introduce a experimentos del mundo real, marcos teóricos y dilemas éticos que sirven como un laberinto para tu mente. Conducido por Rashid Azarang, exploramos las construcciones sociales que guían, y a veces desvían, la acción humana. Acompáñanos en este viaje por las cámaras laberínticas de las complejidades sociales. Gira cada esquina con virtudes como la prudencia y la justicia, guiados por la luz del cuestionamiento socrático y la sutileza ética.
